connector.description: IEC 60870 supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) client using NeoSCADA implementation.

camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.source.endpoint.bridgeErrorHandler.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.name: camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler
camel.source.endpoint.exceptionHandler.description: To let the consumer use a custom ExceptionHandler. Notice if the option bridgeErrorHandler is enabled then this option is not in use. By default the consumer will deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.name: camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern
camel.source.endpoint.exchangePattern.description: Sets the exchange pattern when the consumer creates an exchange. One of: [InOnly] [InOut] [InOptionalOut]

camel.source.endpoint.adsuAddressType.name: camel.source.endpoint.adsuAddressType
camel.source.endpoint.adsuAddressType.description: The common ASDU address size. May be either SIZE_1 or SIZE_2. One of: [SIZE_1] [SIZE_2]

camel.source.endpoint.causeOfTransmissio.name: camel.source.endpoint.causeOfTransmissionType
camel.source.endpoint.causeOfTransmissio.description: The cause of transmission type. May be either SIZE_1 or SIZE_2. One of: [SIZE_1] [SIZE_2]

camel.source.endpoint.informationObjectA.name: camel.source.endpoint.informationObjectAddressType
camel.source.endpoint.informationObjectA.description: The information address size. May be either SIZE_1, SIZE_2 or SIZE_3. One of: [SIZE_1] [SIZE_2] [SIZE_3]

camel.source.endpoint.maxUnacknowledged.name: camel.source.endpoint.maxUnacknowledged
camel.source.endpoint.maxUnacknowledged.description: Parameter K - Maximum number of un-acknowledged messages.

camel.source.endpoint.causeSourceAddress.name: camel.source.endpoint.causeSourceAddress
camel.source.endpoint.causeSourceAddress.description: Whether to include the source address

camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout.name: camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout
camel.source.endpoint.connectionTimeout.description: Timeout in millis to wait for client to establish a connected connection.

camel.source.endpoint.ignoreBackgroundSc.name: camel.source.endpoint.ignoreBackgroundScan
camel.source.endpoint.ignoreBackgroundSc.description: Whether background scan transmissions should be ignored.

camel.source.endpoint.ignoreDaylightSavi.name: camel.source.endpoint.ignoreDaylightSavingTime
camel.source.endpoint.ignoreDaylightSavi.description: Whether to ignore or respect DST

camel.source.endpoint.timeZone.name: camel.source.endpoint.timeZone
camel.source.endpoint.timeZone.description: The timezone to use. May be any Java time zone string

camel.component.iec60870-client.bridgeEr.name: camel.component.iec60870-client.bridgeErrorHandler
camel.component.iec60870-client.bridgeEr.description: Allows for bridging the consumer to the Camel routing Error Handler, which mean any exceptions occurred while the consumer is trying to pickup incoming messages, or the likes, will now be processed as a message and handled by the routing Error Handler. By default the consumer will use the org.apache.camel.spi.ExceptionHandler to deal with exceptions, that will be logged at WARN or ERROR level and ignored.

camel.component.iec60870-client.autowire.name: camel.component.iec60870-client.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.iec60870-client.autowire.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.
